I'm not sure who the original poster is, but here are som=
e recommendations.

1. Kent Beck, "Test-Driven Development by Example"
2. V=
incent Massol, Ted Husted, "JUnit in Action" coming soon
3. "JUnit Cookbook=
" by some guys who frequent this mailing list, coming late 2003/early 2004
=

Books for JUnit are just now bursting onto the scene because, to this poin=
t, the collective wisdom of JUnit has been maintained on the web. There are=
 at least 10 books worth of great information on the web, but if you want b=
ooks, you're getting them. Just be patient.

Take care.
